channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: America's place in the world during a second Trump term
item.description:
Confirmation hearings for Trump's cabinet picks are in full swing on Capitol Hill with a number of them appearing before the Senate this week.

Nominees including Pam Bondi, Trump's pick to run the Justice Department, John Ratcliffe, his pick to run the CIA, and Florida Senator Marco Rubio Trump's nominee for Secretary of State have all answered questions about what they'll do and what they won't do if confirmed.

Rubio and Ratcliffe will play key foreign policy roles under the 47th president.

Those are the people, but what do they tell us about the policy?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org
item.content:encoded:
Confirmation hearings for Trump's cabinet picks are in full swing on Capitol Hill with a number of them appearing before the Senate this week.

Nominees including Pam Bondi, Trump's pick to run the Justice Department, John Ratcliffe, his pick to run the CIA, and Florida Senator Marco Rubio Trump's nominee for Secretary of State have all answered questions about what they'll do and what they won't do if confirmed.

Rubio and Ratcliffe will play key foreign policy roles under the 47th president.

Those are the people, but what do they tell us about the policy?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)

item.title: Israel and Hamas Reach A Deal to End the War in Gaza
item.description:
A ceasefire deal has been announced that would end more than 15 months of war between Israel and Hamas in Gaza. We learn about the details, how the agreement was reached and hear reaction from Israelis and Palestinians. We also look at what the war has meant for both sides and for the Middle East region.

For more coverage of this conflict and the latest developments, please come back to this feed. You can also go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.content:encoded:

item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Will Lewis's first year at 'Washington Post': Cancellations, red ink and an exodus
item.description: Subscribers and star journalists have fled the Post in its first year under CEO and Publisher Will Lewis. Now staff have signed a petition asking owner Jeff Bezos to intervene.
item.content:encoded:
Subscribers and star journalists have fled the Post in its first year under CEO and Publisher Will Lewis. Now staff have signed a petition asking owner Jeff Bezos to intervene.

(Image credit: Marvin Joseph/The Washington Post via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: After half a century in politics, Biden bids farewell in an Oval Office address
item.description: President Biden had once hoped to be giving a second inaugural address. Instead, he'll be saying farewell to public life, and trying to frame his legacy one last time.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden had once hoped to be giving a second inaugural address. Instead, he'll be saying farewell to public life, and trying to frame his legacy one last time.

(Image credit: Mandel Nga)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Flags to be raised for Trump's inauguration, despite half-staff order for Carter's death
item.description: The president-elect had expressed concern that Democrats seemed happy to see the flag lowered during the inauguration ceremony despite the tradition of lowering flags after a president's death.
item.content:encoded:
The president-elect had expressed concern that Democrats seemed happy to see the flag lowered during the inauguration ceremony despite the tradition of lowering flags after a president's death.

(Image credit: Allison Robbert-Pool)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump's Cabinet pick for secretary of transportation is Sean Duffy. Here's what to know
item.description: While some of President-elect Trump's Cabinet nominees faced sharp questioning this week, Sean Duffy received a friendly welcome in his confirmation hearing to be secretary of transportation.
item.content:encoded:
While some of President-elect Trump's Cabinet nominees faced sharp questioning this week, Sean Duffy received a friendly welcome in his confirmation hearing to be secretary of transportation.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Here's everyone performing at the presidential inauguration
item.description: Unlike Donald Trump's 2017 inauguration, which reportedly struggled to book high-profile performers, several well-known artists will partake in this year's inaugural events.
item.content:encoded:
Unlike Donald Trump's 2017 inauguration, which reportedly struggled to book high-profile performers, several well-known artists will partake in this year's inaugural events.

(Image credit: Paras Griffin)
item.dc:creator: Isabella Gomez Sarmiento

item.title: Inflation remains stubbornly high for many Americans. Could it get worse under Trump?
item.description: Consumer prices rose 2.9% in December from a year earlier, marking the third consecutive monthly uptick in annual inflation.
item.content:encoded:
Consumer prices rose 2.9% in December from a year earlier, marking the third consecutive monthly uptick in annual inflation.

(Image credit: Robyn Beck)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: How do you ensure good luck on Lunar New Year? NPR wants to know
item.description: The Lunar New Year falls on Jan. 29 this year. NPR wants to know what traditions you uphold to ensure good luck in the year to come.
item.content:encoded:
The Lunar New Year falls on Jan. 29 this year. NPR wants to know what traditions you uphold to ensure good luck in the year to come.

(Image credit: Nhac Nguyen)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Ancient Celtic tribe had women at its social center
item.description: Ancient DNA reveals that during the Iron Age, women in ancient Celtic societies were at the center of their social networks — unlike previous eras of prehistory.
item.content:encoded:
Ancient DNA reveals that during the Iron Age, women in ancient Celtic societies were at the center of their social networks — unlike previous eras of prehistory.

(Image credit: Miles Russell)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel
